news_header: Finland has three properties in Russia, with one consulate closed and the embassy operating normally. Concerns arise about potential Russian retaliation for property seizures in Finland.
news_text: Finland owns three properties in Russia, two of which are under diplomatic protection. One consulate was closed last year, leaving it empty, while the embassy in Moscow continues to operate. There are concerns about possible Russian retaliation for property seizures in Finland, as Russia may view these actions as a basis for countermeasures. Although some Finnish companies have exited Russia, a few remain, and the situation is complicated by international law and diplomatic agreements.
